channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: With pharaoh-fanfare, Egypt unveils a huge new museum dedicated to its ancient civilization
item.description: CAIRO (AP) — In an extravaganza of pharaonic imagery with a drone light show depicting ancient gods and pyramids in the sky, Egypt on Saturday inaugurated its long-delayed Grand Egyptian Museum, a megaproject aiming to give the country’s millennia-old heritage a rich, modern display.
item.dc:creator: SAMY MAGDY, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Two new suspects handed preliminary charges in Louvre jewels heist case, Paris prosecutor says
item.description: PARIS (AP) — The Paris prosecutor said Saturday two new suspects were handed preliminary charges for their alleged involvement in the crown jewels heist at the Louvre museum, three days after they were arrested by police as part of the sweeping investigation.
item.dc:creator: SYLVIE CORBET, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Former Kentucky Gov. Martha Layne Collins has died at 88
item.description: LEXINGTON, Ky. (AP) — Martha Layne Collins, the first and only woman elected governor of Kentucky, died on Saturday. She was 88.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: With bombs and bravado, Trump puts his own stamp on Reagan's 'peace through strength' mantle
item.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — It wasn’t so long ago that President Donald Trump spoke of building a legacy as a “peacemaker.
item.dc:creator: AAMER MADHANI, BEN FINLEY and MATTHEW LEE, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Ukraine says it hit a key fuel pipeline near Moscow that supplies Russian forces
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian forces hit an important fuel pipeline in the Moscow region that supplies the Russian army, Ukraine's military intelligence said Saturday, as Russia kept up a sustained campaign of massive drone and missile attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: GOP lawmakers question 'long-term fairness' of trade boost to Argentinian beef
item.description: A letter sent by over a dozen GOP lawmakers questions the "long-term fairness by the Trump administration to allow Argentina to quadruple its exports of beef to the United States at a time when Texas and other U.S. cattle ranchers are struggling, Border Report has learned.
item.dc:creator: Sandra Sanchez, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Daylight saving time: These states want to stop changing the clocks
item.description: Nearly every state has considered legislation that would lock the clocks — here's where those efforts stand.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Tanzanian President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: KAMPALA, Uganda (AP) — Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced early Saturday. Her two main opponents had both been prevented from running, leaving her virtually unopposed.
item.dc:creator: RODNEY MUHUMUZA, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: FBI raid at Idaho horse track shows how immigration is a top focus across law enforcement
item.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — The first sign something was amiss was the thwack of helicopter rotors overhead, followed by screams.
item.dc:creator: REBECCA BOONE, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: New-look Dodgers lineup only produces 4 hits but they come at right time as LA forces Game 7
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A new-look lineup for the Los Angeles Dodgers only produced four hits in Game 6, but three of them came in a three-run rally off Blue Jays starter Kevin Gausman.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Mexican Americans balance tradition and modernity in Day of the Dead celebrations
item.description: This weekend, Mexican American families across the U.S. will gather to honor their ancestors with altars, marigolds and sugar skulls on Dia de los Muertos — the Day of the Dead.
item.dc:creator: FERNANDA FIGUEROA, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Federal judge rules Trump can’t require citizenship proof on the federal voting form
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President Donald Trump’s request to add a documentary proof of citizenship requirement to the federal voter registration form cannot be enforced, a federal judge ruled Friday. U.S. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and NICHOLAS RICCARDI, Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Military strikes on Venezuela appear increasingly likely
item.description: The U.S. launching strikes within Venezuela is looking increasingly likely as the Trump administration continues to bolster the buildup of military assets in the region, turning up the pressure against Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, whom U.S.
item.dc:creator: Filip Timotija, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Unidentified remains of 3 people transferred to Israel, Red Cross says
item.description: DEIR AL-BALAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The Red Cross said it transferred the unidentified remains of three people to Israel late Friday but they were still being examined and may not be those of missing hostages, an Israeli military official said.
item.dc:creator: WAFAA SHURAFA and JULIA FRANKEL, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Court says Border Patrol official won't have to brief judge on Chicago-area immigration sweeps
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — An appeals court ruled in favor of the Trump administration Friday and stopped a judge from trying to get daily updates from a Border Patrol official about the government's immigration crackdown in the Chicago area. The court said the order from U.S.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Judge orders arrest of ex-Green Beret tied to failed Venezuela raid after court no-show
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (AP) — A federal judge in Tampa has ordered the arrest of a former Green Beret accused of plotting to invade Venezuela in 2020 after he failed to show up to court for a hearing on whether he should be taken back into custody for violating the conditions of his pre-trial release.
item.dc:creator: CURT ANDERSON and JOSHUA GOODMAN, Associated Press, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: FBI confirms death, injury count in Michigan church shooting
item.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has confirmed the number of dead and injured in the shooting at an LDS church in Grand Blanc, Mich., in Sept.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Bittan, ABC 4

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Disney pulls ABC, ESPN and other content from YouTube TV amid breakdown in talks
item.description: YouTube TV viewers can no longer see Disney channels, including ABC and ESPN, after the two sides failed to agree on a new content distribution deal.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Florida residents fall victim to new crypto scam, $1.1M lost
item.description: Officials said these victims met the scammer on social media, and the scammer initiated a conversation.
item.dc:creator: Summer Poole, NewsNation

item.title: Ohio panel and Virginia lawmakers move forward with congressional redistricting plans
item.description: An Ohio panel adopted new U.S. House districts on Friday that could boost the GOP’s chances of winning two additional seats in next year’s elections and aid President Donald Trump’s efforts to hold on to a slim congressional majority.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, OLIVIA DIAZ and MARK SCOLFORO, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Trump says he’s not considering strikes within Venezuela
item.description: President Trump on Friday said he was not considering strikes within Venezuela following reports his administration had identified potential military targets within the country.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: Virginia teacher shot by 6-year-old student 'thought she was dead' as bodycam emerges
item.description: Virginia teacher Abby Zwerner testifies about being shot by 6-year-old student, telling court, 'I thought I was dead' as police footage reveals chaotic aftermath.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Young adults turn to Quakers' silent worship to offset
item.description: PHILADELPHIA (AP) — At the Arch Street Meeting House in Philadelphia's Old City, more and more young people are seeking respite from a clamorous technological age in the silent worship of a centuries-old faith. Like other Quaker houses of worship, it follows values of simplicity and equality.
item.dc:creator: LUIS ANDRES HENAO, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Ohio OKs new map giving GOP an edge in 2 districts
item.description: The map was created without public input in a unanimous vote from the Ohio Redistricting Commission and will remain in place until 2030.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, NewsNation

item.title: California man accused of raping woman who was seeking immigration help
item.description: “The suspect offered the victim $400 and a discount on her case if she did not contact police,” authorities added.
item.dc:creator: Josh DuBose, NewsNation

item.title: Wisconsin judge puts on hold ruling that required citizenship check of voters
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A Wisconsin judge on Friday put on hold his order that requires elections officials to verify the citizenship of all 3.6 million registered voters in the battleground state before the next statewide election in February.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: The Latest: Trump wants to scrap the filibuster to end the government shutdown
item.description: President Donald Trump is calling on the Senate to scrap the filibuster, so that the Republican majority can bypass Democrats and reopen the federal government.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: What does SNAP stand for? Food assistance program set to be disrupted by government shutdown
item.description: (KRON) -- With the government shutdown that began on Oct. 1 about to enter its second month, dozens of government programs are already being impacted with further disruptions on the horizon.
item.dc:creator: Alex Baker, KRON4

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: Haven't gotten a Facebook settlement check? Here's what to do
item.description: Millions of people owed a piece of the massive $725 million Facebook privacy settlement have been receiving their payments.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KRON4

item.title: JetBlue flight to New Jersey makes emergency descent, injuring as many as 20 passengers
item.description: Fifteen to 20 passengers were injured on a JetBlue flight heading to Newark, New Jersey. The flight was diverted in Florida due to a control issue experienced by the flight crew, according to officials.
item.dc:creator: Matthew Euzarraga, Fox 5

item.title: Black vultures attack and kill cattle. Climate change is one reason they're spreading north
item.description: EMINENCE, Ky. (AP) — Allan Bryant scans the sky as he watches over a minutes-old calf huddled under a tree line with its mother. After a few failed tries, the calf stands on wobbly legs for the first time, looking to nurse. Above, a pair of birds circle in the distance.
item.dc:creator: JOSHUA A. BICKEL and MELINA WALLING, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Cannabis use may boost tobacco addiction risk in young Americans, study finds
item.description: New research from UC San Diego found that cannabis use among youth may be responsible for 13% of new cases of regular tobacco use in the US, suggesting that cannabis use should be considered a major risk factor for later tobacco addiction.
item.dc:creator: Amber Coakley, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Tracking the storm: NYC flood warning, rain totals and wind gusts
item.description: NEW YORK CITY (PIX11) — A nasty storm is making its way through New York City. Flood warning NYC The National Weather Service issued a flood warning for Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and the Bronx Thursday afternoon through 5:30 p.m on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Gustafson, NewsNation
